The main event in this passage is the breakdown and suicidal thoughts experienced by the speaker. The passage mentions the speaker being depressed for about a year, their job sucking, financial stress, and recent separating from their spouse, which led to a breaking point on Saturday, December 30th. The speaker had a major anxiety and depression-fueled breakdown and threatened self-harm, leading to a 72-hour hold over the New Year's weekend. After adjusting their meds and feeling better, they went to counselor and cried, describing their daily mental state. The counselor recommended a vacation, but the speaker is concerned about losing their job.
Post: "I'm just not cut out for this adulting thing. I've been depressed for a year now, and it seems like everything is just piling up on me. My job sucks, I'm drowning in debt, and my recent separation from my spouse has left me feeling lost and alone. I reached my breaking point on Saturday, December 30th, and had a complete meltdown. I was consumed by anxiety and depression, and I even threatened self-harm. It was a scary time for me, but I'm grateful to have made it through that 72-hour hold over the New Year's weekend. Now, I'm trying to focus on my mental health and take things one day at a time. My counselor suggested a vacation, but I'm worried about losing my job if I take too much time off. It's a constant struggle, but I'm determined to find a way to make it work."
